faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Clear answers to the most common questions
faq.cta_text: Still have questions about your specific case?

civil_01.q: How long does an inventory process take?
civil_01.a: It depends on the complexity of the estate and any agreement between heirs. On average, 6 to 12 months. Consensual processes can be faster.

civil_02.q: Can I terminate a lease before the end of the term?
civil_02.a: Yes, with justification and respecting notice periods. We analyse your contract and specific situation to identify the best strategy.

civil_03.q: What to do in case of a road accident?
civil_03.a: Preserve evidence (photos, witnesses), fill in the amicable declaration, seek medical assistance if necessary. Contact us to assess liabilities and compensation.

civil_04.a: It is possible to acquire property through prolonged possession (usually 15-20 years). Requires proof of public, peaceful and good-faith possession. Specific judicial process.

civil_05.q: I have old debts. Do they expire?
civil_05.a: Most debts expire in 5 years (some in 20). Interrupting acts restart deadlines. We analyse your specific situation.

commercial_01.q: How much does it cost to set up a company in Portugal?
commercial_01.a: Costs vary by company type. Express company: ~360 EUR. Traditional limited companies: 300-500 EUR. We support the entire process.

commercial_02.q: What is the difference between sole trader and limited company?
commercial_02.a: Sole trader: 1 partner, personal assets may cover debts. Limited: 2+ partners, liability limited to share capital. We advise based on your case.

commercial_03.q: How to recover debts from non-paying clients?
commercial_03.a: We try out-of-court resolution first. If necessary: injunction, execution or declaratory proceedings. Strategy depends on amounts and evidence.

commercial_04.q: Do I need a lawyer for commercial contracts?
commercial_04.a: We strongly recommend it. Poorly drafted contracts generate expensive litigation. We ensure protection of your interests and legal compliance.

commercial_05.q: What is a shareholders' agreement and why is it important?
commercial_05.a: A document that regulates relations between partners: powers, profit distribution, partner exit. Essential to prevent future conflicts in the company.

labour_01.q: I was dismissed. Am I entitled to compensation?
labour_01.a: It depends on the type of dismissal. If unlawful: mandatory compensation (minimum 15 days salary/year). We analyse your case at no cost in the first consultation.

labour_02.q: How long do I have to contest a dismissal?
labour_02.a: 60 days after written notice of dismissal. Deadlines are strict - contact us immediately to avoid losing your rights.

labour_03.q: Can the employer change my work schedule?
labour_03.a: Within legal limits. Substantial changes require agreement or just cause. Abusive unilateral changes can be contested.

labour_04.q: How do holiday and Christmas bonuses work?
labour_04.a: Non-waivable rights: holiday bonus paid before the holiday, Christmas bonus by 15 December. Non-payment allows contract termination with just cause.

labour_05.q: I had a workplace accident. What now?
labour_05.a: Report immediately to the employer. Right to medical treatment, full salary during recovery, disability compensation. We support the entire process.

family_01.q: How much does a divorce cost in Portugal?
family_01.a: Consensual divorce without children/assets: 300-500 EUR. With asset/child division: 800-2000 EUR. Contested: variable. Transparent quote after first consultation.

family_02.q: Can I divorce without my spouse's consent?
family_02.a: Yes, through contested divorce (without consent). Longer and more complex process. We assess the best strategy for your case.

family_03.a: Based on the child's needs and parents' financial capacity. Considers income, proven expenses, number of children. Adjustable if circumstances change.

family_04.q: Who keeps the house in a divorce?
family_04.a: It depends: owned property (division according to marital regime), rented (parent with children usually stays). Family home may have special rules. We analyse the documents.

family_05.q: Can I change the children's visitation regime?
family_05.a: Yes, if there is a significant change in circumstances. Agreement between parents is preferable. If not: judicial action to change parental responsibility arrangements.
